connector.description: Expose REST services or call external REST services.

camel.sink.path.method.name: camel.sink.path.method
camel.sink.path.method.description: HTTP method to use. One of: [get] [post] [put] [delete] [patch] [head] [trace] [connect] [options]

camel.sink.endpoint.consumes.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consumes
camel.sink.endpoint.consumes.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service accepts. By default we accept all kinds of types.

camel.sink.endpoint.inType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.inType
camel.sink.endpoint.inType.description: To declare the incoming POJO binding type as a FQN class name

camel.sink.endpoint.outType.name: camel.sink.endpoint.outType
camel.sink.endpoint.outType.description: To declare the outgoing POJO binding type as a FQN class name

camel.sink.endpoint.produces.name: camel.sink.endpoint.produces
camel.sink.endpoint.produces.description: Media type such as: 'text/xml', or 'application/json' this REST service returns.

camel.sink.endpoint.routeId.name: camel.sink.endpoint.routeId
camel.sink.endpoint.routeId.description: Name of the route this REST services creates

camel.sink.endpoint.apiDoc.name: camel.sink.endpoint.apiDoc
camel.sink.endpoint.apiDoc.description: The openapi api doc resource to use. The resource is loaded from classpath by default and must be in JSON format.

camel.sink.endpoint.bindingMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.bindingMode
camel.sink.endpoint.bindingMode.description: Configures the binding mode for the producer. If set to anything other than 'off' the producer will try to convert the body of the incoming message from inType to the json or xml, and the response from json or xml to outType. One of: [auto] [off] [json] [xml] [json_xml]

camel.sink.endpoint.host.name: camel.sink.endpoint.host
camel.sink.endpoint.host.description: Host and port of HTTP service to use (override host in openapi schema)

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.producerComponentNam.name: camel.sink.endpoint.producerComponentName
camel.sink.endpoint.producerComponentNam.description: The Camel Rest component to use for (producer) the REST transport, such as http, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestProducerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

camel.sink.endpoint.queryParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.queryParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.queryParameters.description: Query parameters for the HTTP service to call. The query parameters can contain multiple parameters separated by ampersand such such as foo=123&bar=456.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.rest.apiDoc.name: camel.component.rest.apiDoc
camel.component.rest.apiDoc.description: The swagger api doc resource to use. The resource is loaded from classpath by default and must be in JSON format.

camel.component.rest.componentName.name: camel.component.rest.componentName
camel.component.rest.componentName.description: The Camel Rest component to use for (producer) the REST transport, such as http, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestProducerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

camel.component.rest.host.name: camel.component.rest.host
camel.component.rest.host.description: Host and port of HTTP service to use (override host in swagger schema)

camel.component.rest.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.rest.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.rest.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.rest.producerComponentNa.name: camel.component.rest.producerComponentName
camel.component.rest.producerComponentNa.description: The Camel Rest component to use for (producer) the REST transport, such as http, undertow. If no component has been explicit configured, then Camel will lookup if there is a Camel component that integrates with the Rest DSL, or if a org.apache.camel.spi.RestProducerFactory is registered in the registry. If either one is found, then that is being used.

camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBindin.name: camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.rest.basicPropertyBindin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
